remarks: A member of the span of the singleton of a vector is a member of a subspace containing the vector.  ( ~ elspansn4 analog.)  (Contributed by NM, 4-Jul-2014.)
statement:
lspsnel4.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lspsnel4.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lspsnel4.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lspsnel4.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lspsnel4.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lspsnel4.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lspsnel4.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lspsnel4.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( N ` { X } ) ) $.
lspsnel4.z $e |- ( ph -> Y =/= .0. ) $.
lspsnel4 $p |- ( ph -> ( X e. U <-> Y e. U ) ) $.
